intro: Hieracium insidiosum, commonly known as the devil's paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its yellow-orange flowers are surrounded by bracts that resemble a brush, giving it its common name. Hieracium insidiosum is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
